topic.title: Backing up the Docker Trusted Registry (DTR)

body.p: When you backup DTR, you save the data/metadata outlined in :

row.entry: Metadata like image architecture and size
Access control to repos and images
Data about who has access to which images
Signatures and digests for images that are signed
Information about vulnerabilities in your images
TLS certificates and keys used by DTR
Needs to be backed up separately, depends on DTR configuration
Create a UCP backup to backup this data
Can be re-downloaded after a restore

body.p: To make a backup of DTR metadata, use playbook/backup_dtr_metadata.yml
This playbook creates two archives in the folder specified by the variable backup_dest in group_vars/backups. By default, the file is named using the following pattern:

<replica_id> is the ID of the DTR replica that was backed up, <vmname> is the name of the host (in the inventory) that was used to take the backup, and <timestamp> is the time at which the backup was taken. The file with the extension .vars.tgz contains information regarding the system that was backed up.
